DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Supraventricular Arrhythmia Nodal Arrhythmia Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether there is a presence of Supraventricular Arrhythmia (arrhythmia originating from centers proximal to the ventricles) or Nodal Arrhythmia (arrythmia occurring when the atrioventricular node or surrounding junctional tissue is acting as pacemaker) as an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Supraventricular Arrhythmia Nodal Arrhythmia Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of Supraventricular Arrhythmia (arrhythmia originating from centers proximal to the ventricles) or Nodal Arrhythmia (arrythmia occurring when the atrioventricular node or surrounding junctional tissue is acting as pacemaker) as an abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: An arrhythmia originating from centers proximal to the ventricles, namely in the atrium, AV node, or AV junction, in contrast to arrhythmias arising in the ventricles themselves.:Nodal arrhythmia is arrythmia occurring when the atrioventricular node or surrounding junctional tissue is acting as pacemaker.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an arrhythmia originating in the atrium, AV node or AV junction.
An electrocardiographic finding of an arrhythmia originating from within the atrioventricular node.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have suprave
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have supraventricular or nodal arrhythmias requiring a pacemaker or not controlled with medication?
